Module contents¶

class textarena.wrappers.ClipCharactersActionWrapper(env: Env, max_num_characters: int)[source]¶

Bases: ActionWrapper

Action wrapper that limits actions to a maximum number of characters.

This wrapper truncates the player’s action if it exceeds the specified maximum number of characters.

action(action: str) → str[source]¶

Truncates the action to the maximum number of characters.

Parameters:

action (str) – The original action.

Returns:

The truncated action.

Return type:

str

class textarena.wrappers.ClipWordsActionWrapper(env: Env, max_num_words: int)[source]¶

Bases: ActionWrapper

Action wrapper that limits actions to a maximum number of words.

This wrapper truncates the player’s action if it exceeds the specified maximum number of words.

action(action: str) → str[source]¶

Truncates the action to the maximum number of words.

Parameters:

action (str) – The original action.

Returns:

The truncated action.

Return type:

str

class textarena.wrappers.LLMObservationWrapper(env: Env)[source]¶

Bases: ObservationWrapper

A wrapper for converting environment observations into formatted strings suitable for large language models (LLMs). It ensures that duplicate observations are not added to the full observations.

observation(player_id: int, observation: dict[int, List[Tuple[int, str]]] | None)[source]¶
class textarena.wrappers.SimpleRenderWrapper(env: Env, player_names: Dict[int, str] | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: RenderWrapper

A general-purpose render wrapper that provides a formatted and enhanced rendering of any environment.

This wrapper uses the ‘rich’ library to render the game state and logs in a more readable and visually appealing way. It is designed to be flexible and work with any game environment that provides a ‘state’ object with ‘game_state’ and ‘logs’.

GAME_KEYWORD_COLOR = 'cyan'¶
GAME_MESSAGE_COLOR = 'yellow'¶
PLAYER_COLORS = ['red', 'green', 'blue', 'magenta', 'bright_red', 'bright_green', 'bright_yellow', 'bright_blue', 'bright_magenta', 'bright_cyan']¶
step(action: str) → Tuple[Dict[int, int] | None, bool, bool, Dict[str, Any] | None][source]¶

Performs a single step in the environment.

Parameters:

  • player_id (int) – The ID of the player taking the action.

  • action (str) – The action to be taken by the player.

Returns:

  • done (bool): Whether the episode has concluded

  • info (Dict[str, Any]): Additional information about the environment.

Return type:

Tuple containing
